results.title: The Man in the blue and white Holden
results.creator_credit: Peter Luby, Jane Karslake and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: A comedy with suspense about childhood fears set in the late sixties. Following the disappearance of the Beaumont children, Colin is warned about a malevolent stranger who has abducted children. Colin believes he is being shadowed by the man in a blue and white Holden. The film recalls the childhood fears drummed into children by teachers and parents, of strangers in cars. Cast includes Jeffrey Walker, Fiona Corke and Chris McLean.

results.title: The Man in grey
results.creator_credit: Leslie Arliss, Edward Black and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: First of the very popular British costume melodramas produced by Gainsborough and often thought of as the best in the collection, “The Man in grey” is a tale of intrigue that twists and turns its way to a dramatic conclusion. The story begins at an antique auction in London during WWII and then proceeds to flashback to 19th century regal England to the aristocratic world of Clarissa Richmond (Phyllis Calvert) and her loveless marriage to the rather indifferent Lord Rohan (James Mason) - the “man in grey”, whose sole intent is in fathering an heir. Clarissa soon finds herself distracted by the attentions of the handsome Rokeby (Stewart Granger) introduced to her by her old schoolfriend, Hester (Margaret Lockwood) who in turn falls for Lord Rohan. Deceit, love and betrayal weave their way into this web of treachery where circumstances and fate can only lead to a tragic conclusion. Magnificent performances by all four stars. Based on the novel by Lady Eleanor Smith, adapted by Doreen Montgomery with screenplay by Margaret Kennedy and Leslie Arliss.

results.title: The Man hunters
results.brief_description: An introduction to the study of fossil homo sapiens, this film provides a starting point for more detailed discussions. Presents a time line upon which only a small part represents recorded history, the rest is pre-history. The film also discusses a 100 year search by scientists for the earliest evidence of human existence. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Man from Tocumwal
results.creator_credit: Ken Dyer, John Sparkes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A study of Fred James, managing director of the textile firm Cleckheaton, and new owner of the famous Falkiner Merino Stud at Congaro, N.S.W. James explains his interest in the wool industry, criticises the Australian Wool Board and discusses wool’s marketing and promotional problems. Also shows his modern textile mill at Shepparton, Victoria.

results.title: The Man from Snowy River II
results.brief_description: Jim Craig has been away on the plains droving and gathering a large mob of horses to breed in his high country. Now he has returned to claim his heritage and the woman he loves. “The Man From Snowy River II” continues the legend and brings to life a man whose simple strength will endure forever.

results.title: The Man from Snowy River
results.brief_description: The Man From Snowy River, based on the classic Australian poem by Banjo Patterson, tells the story of an 18 year old boy who proves himself a man during an unforgettable chase on horseback down the rugged Snowy Mountains and becomes a legend. The most magnificent footage of horses ever filmed.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.title: The Man from Maisinicu = El hombre de Maisinicu
results.creator_credit: Manuel Perez, Santiago Llapur and ICAIC
results.brief_description: A film of adventure, armed combat and political intrigue, ‘The Man from Maisinicu’ depicts the life of a man who tries to bring the calming effects of sound farm management into the midst of the fray. The film is set in the Escambray Mountains in early 1964, then the scene of intense conflict between peasant farmers of the region and the counterrevolutionary bands spreading terror amongst the local population while trying to re-establish contact with the CIA. Amidst a backdrop of political intrigue and espionage, Alberto Delgado y Delgado was sent to manage the Maisinicu Co-operative Farm. When his body was found in a clearing in the nearby woods, an investigation was launched and the resulting story of his last 14 months forms the basis of the film, told in flashback. Cast includes Sergio Corrieri, Reinaldo Miravalles, Raul Romanes. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Man from Laramie
results.creator_credit: Anthony Mann, William Goetz and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Anthony Mann’s classic western tells the story of Will Lockhart (James Stewart) and his search for revenge for the death of his youngest brother. He leaves Laramie in search of the men who sold automatic rifles to the Apache tribe which killed his brother. He arrives in Coronado and is soon embroilled in a bitter battle with the Waggoman family who own most of the land and cattle in the township. Full of great characters and twists in plot, “The Man From Laramie” is an enthralling film with characters who defy simplistic moralistic platitutes.

results.title: The Man from kangaroo (1920)
results.creator_credit: Wilfrid Lucas, Reg L Baker and E.J. Carroll
results.brief_description: This film, starring “Snowy Baker”, is about John Harland, a pugilist turned parson, who is posted to the town of Kangaroo where a gang of thugs has driven the Church out of the area. Harland defies the gang by holding a service in the Town Hall but it is disrupted by threats of violence. In defeat, Harland seeks a job as a stationhand and discovers that his sweetheart, Muriel owns a neighbouring property and that her overseer is none other than Red Jack Braggan, the leader of the gang. Red Jack kidnaps Muriel, but after many fights and chases she is rescued by Harland and the town is rid of its rowdy element.

results.title: The Man from East Liverpool: Ben Feldman
results.creator_credit: Jay J. Sheridan and Jay J Sheridan and Company
results.brief_description: Instructional film on salesmanship and setting goals for yourself. Uses Insurance salesman Ben Feldman as the focus. He gives a background of himself and how he got to where he is today. He is shown in action conducting sales in real scenarios demonstrating the attitudes needed to achieve personal success.
